intro: Hieracium placophoroides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and the flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is often found in temperate climates and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
